tool.name: IonFlow
tool.description: Pipeline for processing and analysis of ionomics data
tool.command:
Rscript ${__tool_directory__}/ionflow.R --ion_file '$ion_file' --var_id '$pre_proc.var_id' --batch_id '$pre_proc.batch_id' --data_id '$pre_proc.data_id' --method_outl '$pre_proc.method_outl' --method_batch '$pre_proc.method_batch' --scale_batch '$pre_proc.scale_batch'
## use std file or not --std_file_sel '$pre_proc.std.std_file_sel' #if $pre_proc.std.std_file_sel=='yes': --std_file '$pre_proc.std.std_file' #end if
## Clustering and network analysis --thres_clus '$clus_net.thres_clus' --thres_anno '$clus_net.thres_anno' --thres_simil '$clus_net.thres_simil' --method_simil '$clus_net.method_simil'
## output: pre-processing --pre_proc_pdf '$pre_proc_pdf' --df_stats_out '$df_stats_out' --outl_out '$outl_out' --data_wide_out '$data_wide_out' --data_wide_symb_out '$data_wide_symb_out'
## output: exploratory analysis --exp_anal_pdf '$exp_anal_pdf'
## output: gene clustering --gene_clus_pdf '$gene_clus_pdf' --clus_out '$clus_out' --anno_out '$anno_out' --enri_out '$enri_out'
## output: gene network --gene_net_pdf '$gene_net_pdf' --imbe_out '$imbe_out' --imbe_tab_out '$imbe_tab_out'

param.name: ion_file
param.label: Ion data table
param.help: Ion data table with columns of Ions and rows of knockout. The first two columns must be names of knowckout and batch ID.

param.name: var_id
param.label: Specify variable column index of input data
param.help: Indicate which column will be the variable (Knockout).

param.name: batch_id
param.label: Specify batch ID column index of input data
param.help: Indicate which column will be batch ID.

param.name: data_id
param.label: Specify data start column index of input data
param.help: Indicate which column will be the start of data matrix.

param.name: method_outl
param.label: Select a method for outlier detection
param.help: Univariate outlier detection. Currently support 'boxplot', 'median' and 'mean'.

param.name: method_batch
param.label: Select a method for batch correction
param.help: Batch correction method, i.e, shift batch median or mean.

param.name: scale_batch
param.label: Scale batch correction with STD
param.help: Batch shifting followed by division of std or not

param.name: std_file_sel
param.label: Use user defined ion std file or not
param.help: Use manul std values or calculation from ion data for standardisation.

param.name: std_file
param.label: STD file
param.help: A data matrix with only two columns. The fisrt column is the names of ion and the second one is std values.

param.name: thres_clus
param.label: Specify clustering threshold
param.help: Gene number threshold in a hierarchical clustering centre.

param.name: thres_anno
param.label: Specify annotation percentage threshold
param.help: Percentage threshold for annotation (0 - 100). Features large than threshold will be kept.

param.name: thres_simil
param.label: Specify similarity threshold
param.help: Similarity threshold for network analysis (0 - 1). Features large than threshold will be kept.

param.name: method_simil
param.label: Select a method for data matrix similarity
param.help: Methods for data matrix similarity. Four methods, 'correlation', 'cosine', 'eJaccard' and 'Mahalanobis', are available. Note that Mahalanobis similarity is converted from distance.

data.name: df_stats_out
data.label: Statistical summary of data set on ${on_string}

data.name: data_wide_out
data.label: Pre-processed data in wide format on ${on_string}

data.name: data_wide_symb_out
data.label: Symbolization data in wide format on ${on_string}

data.name: exp_anal_pdf
data.label: Explanatation analysis plots for Ions on ${on_string}

data.name: imbe_tab_out
data.label: Impact and betweenness contingency table on ${on_string}

tool.help:
IonFlow Pipeline =================
Description -----------
This galaxy tool wraps R package IonFlow_ to process ionomics data to aid reproducible data sharing and big data initiatives.
The pipeline includes:
Pre-processing This procedure uses quantile (boxplot) method to perform outlier detection, median shift for batch correction, standard derivation of each ion for standardisation after logarithm transformation. The processed concentration data and a symbolization profile data are returned for further analysis.
Exploratory analysis It includes PCA analysis, hierarchical clustering for both ion and knockout, and correlation analysis with heatmap and network analysis.
Gene Clustering This stage uses hierarchical clustering based on symbolised profile. The genes located in the clustering centre with number large than a threshold are then used for the GO Slim annotation and the GO terms enrichment analysis.
Gene Network This part uses hierarchical clustering based on the symbolised profile to select genes located in the clustering centre with number large than a threshold for correlation analysis. Genes with correlation coefficient large than a threshold are then used for network analysis. Some network analysis stats such as impact and betweenness are also returned.
.. _IonFlow: https://github.com/AlinaPeluso/MetaboFlow
Inputs ------
**\1. Ionomics data**
The input file is an ionomics data table in tubular format. The following is an example with the first two columns of knockout name and batch ID and other columns are ions.
+----------+----------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+ | Knockout | Batch_ID | Ca | Cd | Cu | Fe | K | Mg | Mo | Na | Ni | P | S | +----------+----------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+ | YDL227C | 14 | 59.549 | 0.953 | 2.202 | 10.942 | 3448.070 | 693.992 | 1.603 | 259.816 | 1.573 | 4963.315 | 556.397 | +----------+--+-------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+ | YDL227C | 14 | 62.258 | 0.927 | 2.067 | 26.262 | 3493.741 | 705.008 | 2.691 | 273.640 | 4.443 | 4874.101 | 553.229 | +----------+--+-------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+ | YDL227C | 14 | 65.075 | 0.875 | 2.048 | 10.244 | 3317.611 | 691.411 | 1.878 | 278.167 | 1.448 | 4608.300 | 535.609 | +----------+--+-------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+ | YDL227C | 14 | 56.886 | 0.985 | 2.203 | 9.206 | 3330.854 | 702.734 | 1.396 | 268.609 | 1.640 | 5119.736 | 546.230 | +----------+----------+---------+-------+-------+--------+----------+---------+-------+---------+-------+----------+----------+
|
**\2. STD values**
Standard derivation values can be provide by user or calculated from ion data set. These values are used to standardize ion data. The user defined std file has tabular format such as:
+------+----------+ | Ion | sd | +------+----------+ | Ca | 0.150 | +------+----------+ | Fe | 0.163 | +------+----------+ | K | 0.094 | +------+----------+ | Mg | 0.059 | +------+----------+ | Na | 0.107 | +------+----------+ | Ni | 0.078 | +------+----------+ | Zn | 0.067 | +------+----------+
|
Parameters ----------
**\1. Threshold for cluster**
The threshold is for the gene number in a cluster centre with the default value of 10. Genes located in a cluster center with gene number large than the threshold will be used for further analysis, such as annotation and network analysis.
**\2. Threshold for annotation**
The threshold is for the percentage of the genes in a cluster centre used for annotation. The default is 5 percent. Genes with percentage large than threshold will be annotated.
**\3. Threshold for similarity**
The threshold is for the similarity cut-off for network analysis. Only those large than the threshold will be used in the network analysis. The default is 0.6 in the range of 0 and 1.
**\4. Outlier detection**
Three methods, "mean", "median" and "boxplot", are implemented. "mean" is less robust. For details, see Wilcox R R, Fundamentals of Modern Statistical Methods: Substantially Improving Power and Accuracy, Springer 2010 (2nd edition), pages 31-35. Also see R package GmAMisc_.
.. _GmAMisc: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/GmAMisc/index.html
- *mean*: an observation is an outlier if the absolute difference between that observation and the sample mean is more than 2 Standard Deviations away from the mean.
- *median*: an observation is an outlier if the absolute difference between the observation and the sample median is larger than the Median Absolute Deviation divided by 0.6745.
- *boxplot*: an observation is an outlier if it is either smaller than the 1st quartile minus 1.5 times the interquartile range, or larger than the 3rd quartile minus 1.5 times the interquartile range.
**\6. Batch correction**
The batch correction is to remove batch effects by shifting batch median or mean.
**\7. Batch scalling**
The batch correction can be scaled by the stadnard derivation.
**\8. Similarity measures**
The network extraction is based on the data matrix similarity measures. Three widely-used measures, *correlation*, *cosine* and *Jaccard*, and *Mahalanobis similarity*, which is converted from *Mahalanobis distance*, are used in the galaxy tools. For details, see R package proxy_.
.. _proxy: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/proxy/index.html
Outputs ----------
**\1. Pre-processing**
The output includes:
- A PDF file for the plots: dot-plot with ion vs batch and distribution plot of ions. - A tabular file for statistical summary of data set - A tabular file for outlier table - A tabular file for processed data set - A tabular file for the symbolisation data set
**\2. Exploratory analysis**
A single PDF file is output with plots:
- correlation map heatmap with dendrogram, correlation heatmap with dendrogram - correlation network graph PCA plot
**\3. Gene Clustering**
PDF and tubular files include:
- A PDF file for gene clustering in separate cluster centre - A tabular for clustering table - A tabular file for annotation table - A tabular file for enrichment table
**\4. Gene Network**
Three files are returned:
- A PDF file for plots: network graph and impact scatter plot - A tabular file for impact and betweenness table - A tabular file for impact and betweenness contingency table
